metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34903 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
GnuPG through 2.3.6, in unusual situations where an attacker possesses anysecret-key information from a victim's keyring and other constraints (e.g.,use of GPGME) are met, allows signature forgery via injection into thestatus line.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34903` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6+esm1
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6+esm1
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gnupg package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.6+esm1').
